Authors:
Lakmali S. Dissanayake, Sajeewa S.N. Maharachchikumbura,
Peter E Mortimer, Kevin D. Hyde, Ji-Chuan KANG
Title:
Acrocordiella yunanensis sp. nov. (Requienellaceae,
Xylariales) from Yunnan, China
Keywords:
1 new species, microfungi, phylogeny, saprobic,
Sordariomycetes, taxonomy
Abstract:
A collection of an undescribed wood-inhabiting fungal
saprobe from Xishuangbanna, China revealed a new species of
Requienellaceae (Sordariomycetes, Ascomycota) with a distinct sexual
morph. Phylogenies based on LSU and ITS sequence data were used to
determine the relationship of the new taxon. Acrocordiella yunnanensis
sp. nov. is introduced in this paper and is closely related to
Acrocordiella omanensis in Requienellaceae. The novel taxon is
illustrated and described, and a morphology-based key is provided to
facilitate identification of species of Acrocordiella.
